Post.title: GitHub pages
Post._content:
WordPressBlog Html + CSS  GitHub GitHub pages+Hexo

<!-- more -->

## 1. git   - GitHub  git 

 Git Bash  git  GitHub 

### 1.1.  SSH keys 

  > $ cd ~/. ssh

  ssh " No such file or directory "  SSH keys

### 1.2.  SSH Key

  > $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "xxx@xxxmail.com"

  

  ```bash
  The key fingerprint is:
  SHA256:deq65ahsK3kXY7xuTo5eIplsJLnKlwJTlHPcxb9v/GQ xxx@xxx.com
  The key's randomart image is:
  +---[RSA 2048]----+
  |   o . o.        |
  |  + o . .        |
  | . o     .. .    |
  |  ..     ..o     |
  | .o .  .S ..     |
  |o  = o  =..      |
  |... B...o+oo  E  |
  |.o +ooo*+=  +o   |
  |..o  =*BB... ..  |
  +----[SHA256]-----+
  ```

### 1.3.  SSH keys  GitHub

   id_rsa.pub  GitHub.com > Personal settings > SSH keys (_New SSH key_)

### 1.4. 

  > $ ssh -T git@github.com

   yes 

  ```
  Hi xx! You've successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not provide shell access.
  ```

### 1.5. 

  > $ git config --global user.name "your_name" $ git config --global user.email "your_email@youremail.com"

  > $ git config --list // git



## 2.  HEXO
  [](http://xiaolai.li/2016/06/22/makecs-build-a-blog-with-hexo-on-github/#more)


## 3. 

  [NexT.Pisces](https://github.com/iissnan/hexo-theme-next)
  [NexT.Pisces](http://theme-next.iissnan.com/getting-started.html)


### 3.1. 

  - 
    [http://theme-next.iissnan.com/theme-settings.html#tags-page]

  - 
    [https://github.com/iissnan/hexo-theme-next/issues/857]


### 3.2. 

  [NexT.Pisces-](https://github.com/00mu/00mu.github.io/tree/source)00mu.github.iosource


## 4. 

  - ` hexo generate ` 
  - ` hexo server ` localhost:4000 
  - ` hexo deploy`  Github https://00mu.github.io/ 


## 

   GitHub Pages push

  [](https://pages.github.com/)

  1.  00mu.github.com 
         GitHub 
  2.  clone 
  3.  index.html 
  4. push 
  5.

Post.title: Git Bash
Post._content:
Github  git  SVN  git ...

<!-- more -->

## 1. Git Bash 


### 1.1.  Git Bash

  - windows [<https://git-for-windows.github.io/>]
  - `git --help git` git


### 1.2.  Git 

  - NameEmail

    > git config --global user.name "Your Name" git config --global user.email "email@example.com"

  - 

    > git config user.name "Your Name" git config user.email "email@example.com" git config --list 

  - Git  Vi  Vim

    > git config --global core.editor atom

  - 

    > git config --list


### 1.3. 

  - `mkdir HtmlCode` 
  - `cd HtmlCode` 
  - `pwd` 


### 1.4. 

  - `git init` git *clone*
  - `git clone [url] D://HtmlCode` 



## 2. Git WorkFlow

### 2.1. 

  Git  workspaceindexlocal repositoryremote repository

   Git 

  1. 
  2. 
  3.  Git 
  4. 

  - `git status` 
  - `git diff` 
  - `git add .` 
  - `git commit -m ""`  HEAD
  - `git push` 


### 2.2. 

- `git log` 
- `git log --oneline`
- `git reflog` 


### 2.3.  untracked

  - `git clean -f`  untracked 
  - `git clean -fd`  untracked  _ -n _ `git clear -nfd`


### 2.4. 

  ![](/article_images/D1_git-stage.png)

  - `git checkout -- <file1> <file2>`  HEAD ,
  - `git checkout -f` commit
  - `git checkout <commitID>` 
  - `git checkout HEAD <file>` 
  - `git reset --soft HEAD^` 
  - `git reset --soft <commitID>` 

    ```
    --soft  
    --mixed  
    --hard  
    ```

  - `git reset <commit_id>` commit
  - `git rm --cached <file1> <file2>` 


## 3. 

### 3.1 

  - `git fetch p` 
  - `git branch` *
  - `git branch -r` 
  - `git branch -a` 
  - `git branch -va` +log
  - `git branch -ar` +log
  - `git branch <branch>` 
  - `git checkout <branch>` 
  - `git checkout -b <branch>` +
  - `git merge <branch>` 
  - `git branch -D <branch>` 


### 3.2. 


#### 3.2.1. 

  - `git fetch` 


#### 3.2.1. 

  - `git checkout -b <localBranch> <remotes/origin/remoteBranch>`


#### 3.2.2.   

  - `git pull origin <remoteBranch>` 
  - `git pull origin <remoteBranch>:<localBranch>` 
  - `git merge origin/<remoteBranch>` merge


#### 3.2.3. 

  - `git push -u origin <branch>`  `git push`
  - `git push <origin> <localBranch>:<remoteBranch>` 
  - `git branch --set-upstream-to=origin/<branch>` 
  - `git branch -vv` 
  - `git push <origin>` push
  - `git push` 
  -  `git branch -D <branch1> <branch2>` 
  -  `git push origin :<remoteBranch>`  *`:`


## 3. Work Flow

### 3.1. 

  1. `git checkout -b <branch_feature> origin/master` masterbug_
  2. -
  3.  `git stash`
  4. `git pull origin master` 
  5.  `stash`  `git stash pop` 
  6. `git add .` `git commit -m ""` commit 
  7. `git push -u origin <branch_feature>` 
  8. pull request, <branch_feature>  master
  11. PR 


### 3.2. Work Flow 

#### 3.2.1. 

  `git checkout -b <branch_local> origin/<branch_remote>`

   `git fetch`

#### 3.2.2. 

  `git merge origin/<branch_remote>`
  or
  `git pull origin <branch_remote>`

  git fetch
  git pull



#### 3.2.2.  pullRequest 

  eg. vNext_promotion  vNext 

  - `git pull`
  - `git fetch origin vNext` & `git merge origin/vNext` 
  - `git push` PR

## 3. Work Flow

### 3.1. 

  1. `git checkout -b <branch_feature> origin/master` masterbug_
  2. -

  6. `git add .` `git commit -m ""` commit 
  7. `git push -u origin <branch_feature>` 
  8. pull request, <branch_feature>  master
  11. PR 


### 3.2. Work Flow 

#### 3.2.1. 

  `git checkout -b <branch_local> origin/<branch_remote>`

   `git fetch`

#### 3.2.2. 

  `git merge origin/<branch_remote>`
  or
  `git pull origin <branch_remote>`

  git fetch
  git pull



#### 3.2.2.  pullRequest 

  eg. vNext_promotion  vNext 

  - `git pull`
  - `git fetch origin vNext` & `git merge origin/vNext` 
  - `git push` PR
Post.content:
Github git SVN git

1. Git Bash

1.1. Git Bash

  • windows [https://git-for-windows.github.io/]
  • git --help git git

1.2. Git

  • NameEmail

    git config global user.name Your Name git config global user.email email@example.com

  • git config user.name Your Name git config user.email email@example.com git config list

  • Git Vi Vim

    git config global core.editor atom

  • git config list

1.3.

  • mkdir HtmlCode
  • cd HtmlCode
  • pwd

1.4.

  • git init git clone
  • git clone [url] D://HtmlCode

2. Git WorkFlow

2.1.

Git workspaceindexlocal repositoryremote repository

Git

  3. Git
  • git status
  • git diff
  • git add .
  • git commit -m "" HEAD
  • git push

2.2.

  • git log
  • git log --oneline
  • git reflog

2.3. untracked

  • git clean -f untracked
  • git clean -fd untracked -n git clear -nfd

2.4.

  • git checkout -- <file1> <file2> HEAD ,
  • git checkout -f commit
  • git checkout <commitID>
  • git checkout HEAD <file>
  • git reset --soft HEAD^

  • git reset --soft <commitID>

  • git reset <commit_id> commit

  • git rm --cached <file1> <file2>

3.

3.1

  • git fetch p
  • git branch *
  • git branch -r
  • git branch -a
  • git branch -va +log
  • git branch -ar +log
  • git branch <branch>
  • git checkout <branch>
  • git checkout -b <branch> +
  • git merge <branch>
  • git branch -D <branch>

3.2.

3.2.1.

  • git fetch

3.2.1.

  • git checkout -b <localBranch> <remotes/origin/remoteBranch>

3.2.2.

  • git pull origin <remoteBranch>
  • git pull origin <remoteBranch>:<localBranch>
  • git merge origin/<remoteBranch> merge

3.2.3.

  • git push -u origin <branch> git push
  • git push <origin> <localBranch>:<remoteBranch>
  • git branch --set-upstream-to=origin/<branch>
  • git branch -vv
  • git push <origin> push
  • git push
  • git branch -D <branch1> <branch2>
  • git push origin :<remoteBranch> *:

3. Work Flow

3.1.

  1. git checkout -b <branch_feature> origin/master masterbug_
  2. -
  3. git stash
  4. git pull origin master
  5. stash git stash pop
  6. git add . git commit -m "" commit
  7. git push -u origin <branch_feature>
  8. pull request, master
  9. PR

3.2. Work Flow

3.2.1.

git checkout -b <branch_local> origin/<branch_remote>

git fetch

3.2.2.

git merge origin/<branch_remote>
or
git pull origin <branch_remote>

git fetch
git pull

3.2.2. pullRequest

eg. vNext_promotion vNext

  • git pull
  • git fetch origin vNext & git merge origin/vNext
  • git push PR
